Name: Essential Training - Eau Claire, WI
Short description: Overview\nThe Essential In-Person Training introduces students and clinicians to Graston Technique (GT) therapy, its clinical applications, physiological effects, benefits, and potential contraindications. The course begins with a 3-hour, self-paced pre-course followed by a full-day, hands-on, in-person session hosted by a GT Instructor at a clinic or facility near you. This training enables GT Providers to effectively treat scar tissue and fascial restrictions, improving and maintaining optimal range of motion.
Description:
Overview

The primary objective of the Essential course is to develop an understanding of Graston Technique© therapy (GT) and how to apply it into the full spectrum of musculoskeletal treatment approaches. The course also instructs clinicians on the proper use of the instruments. By the end of the training, you will be able to:
  • Demonstrate a working knowledge of the Graston Technique© brand instruments, GT treatments, potential effects, and benefits.
  • Identify and discuss the indications, contraindications (relative and absolute) of GT.
  • Review and develop a better understanding of soft tissue injury, healing and potential reactivity to instrument-assisted soft tissue mobilization (therapeutic and adverse).
  • Develop skill and competence in the GT application of IASTM to the major regions of soft tissue.
Categories: Essential Training > ESS In-Person, Essential Training

Name: Essential Training - Portland, ME (Sep 6, 2025)
Description:
Date: September 6, 2025
Location: Holiday Inn by the Bay
Instructor: Kelsey Taylor

Earn 12 CEUs

Event Overview

Join us for the Graston Technique® Essential Training, a comprehensive workshop designed to introduce healthcare professionals to the Graston Technique® (GT) therapy, a leading instrument-assisted soft tissue mobilization (IASTM) technique. This full-day training will provide hands-on learning and education on the foundational principles and practices of GT, enabling participants to enhance their clinical skills and improve patient outcomes.

What to Expect

  • Foundational Training: Gain in-depth knowledge of the Graston Technique® therapy principles, instrument application, and treatment protocols.
  • Hands-On Experience: Practice using the GT instruments in a supervised setting with direct feedback from an expert instructor.
  • Clinical Applications: Learn how to integrate GT therapy into your practice to treat a wide variety of musculoskeletal conditions effectively.

Why Attend?

  • Earn 12 CEUs upon completion.
  • Equip yourself with the latest techniques in instrument-assisted soft tissue mobilization.
  • Network with fellow healthcare professionals and expand your professional connections.

Don’t miss this opportunity to elevate your expertise in the Graston Technique® and provide even better care for your patients!
Categories: Essential Training > ESS In-Person, Essential Training

Name: Essential Virtual Training - (Apr 26, 2025)
Short description: Live Online Essential Training for CORA
Description:
Event Details:
  • Date: Apr 26, 2025
  • Format: 3-hour self-paced pre-course + live virtual sessions
  • Platform: Zoom
  • Instructor: Michael Racette
  • CEUs: 12 Continuing Education Units
Join Our Comprehensive Graston Technique Virtual Training and Earn 12 CEUs! Elevate your professional skills with our Essential Virtual Training on Apr 26, 2025. This flexible program begins with a 3-hour self-paced pre-course, allowing you to learn the fundamentals at your convenience. Following the pre-course, join live group sessions hosted on Zoom by renowned instructor Michael Racette, an expert in the Graston Technique (GT). Course Highlights:
  • Hands-On Lab Sessions: Experience practical training covering key body areas, such as the knee, hip, spine, shoulder, and more.
  • Expert-Led Instruction: Gain in-depth knowledge and skills with guidance from Michael Racette, ensuring mastery in instrument-assisted soft tissue mobilization (IASTM).
  • Earn 12 CEUs: This course qualifies for 12 Continuing Education Units (CEUs), helping you meet your professional development goals while enhancing patient outcomes.
Why Attend This Training?
  • Flexible Learning: Start with a self-paced pre-course and continue with live sessions tailored to your schedule.
  • Professional Growth: Expand your clinical skills and earn valuable CEUs.
  • Expert Guidance: Learn directly from Michael Racette, a leading authority in the field of soft tissue mobilization.
 Secure your spot in the Essential Virtual Training and take your practice to the next level. This training is perfect for healthcare professionals looking to deepen their expertise in the Graston Technique and enhance patient care. Don’t miss this opportunity to advance your skills and achieve your certification with 12 CEUs!
Categories: Essential Training > ESS Virtual Training, Essential Training

Name: Advanced Training - Indianapolis, IN (Nov 08, 2025)
Description:
First Day: Nov 08, 2025
Time: 08:00 am - 05:30 pm

Last Day: Nov 09, 2025

Time: 07:30 am - 01:30 pm
Location: Indianapolis, IN

Earn 14 CEUs

Event Overview

Take your expertise in the Graston Technique® to the next level with our Advanced Training session in Indianapolis, IN. This intensive course is designed for practitioners who have already completed the Essential Training and are looking to deepen their understanding and refine their skills in instrument-assisted soft tissue mobilization (IASTM).

This advanced training will explore more complex clinical applications of the Graston Technique®, providing participants with the knowledge and skills to handle more challenging cases and achieve better patient outcomes.

Why Attend This Advanced Training?

  • Deepen Your Expertise: Build on your foundational knowledge of the Graston Technique® and learn advanced treatment strategies for more complex cases.
  • Hands-On Practice: Engage in interactive, hands-on sessions to refine your technique and improve your confidence in using the Graston Technique® for a broader range of conditions.
  • Expand Your Clinical Applications: Learn to integrate advanced IASTM techniques into your practice for more effective treatment of soft tissue injuries, scar tissue, and fascial restrictions.
  • Earn Continuing Education Units (CEUs): This training is accredited, allowing you to earn additional CEUs to fulfill your professional development requirements.

How to Register:

Advance your clinical practice and skills with this comprehensive advanced training session. Register Now to secure your spot.

For more information or any questions, please contact us at info@grastontechnique.com.

Don’t miss this opportunity to elevate your expertise in the Graston Technique® and provide even better care for your patients!
Categories: Advanced Training > ADV In-Person, Advanced Training

Time: 08:00 am - 05:30 pm

Last Day: Dec 07, 2025

Time: 07:30 am - 01:30 pm
Location: West Boylston, MA

Earn 14 CEUs

Event Overview

Take your expertise in the Graston Technique® to the next level with our Advanced Training session in West Boylston, MA. This intensive course is designed for practitioners who have already completed the Essential Training and are looking to deepen their understanding and refine their skills in instrument-assisted soft tissue mobilization (IASTM).

This advanced training will explore more complex clinical applications of the Graston Technique®, providing participants with the knowledge and skills to handle more challenging cases and achieve better patient outcomes.

Why Attend This Advanced Training?

  • Deepen Your Expertise: Build on your foundational knowledge of the Graston Technique® and learn advanced treatment strategies for more complex cases.
  • Hands-On Practice: Engage in interactive, hands-on sessions to refine your technique and improve your confidence in using the Graston Technique® for a broader range of conditions.
  • Expand Your Clinical Applications: Learn to integrate advanced IASTM techniques into your practice for more effective treatment of soft tissue injuries, scar tissue, and fascial restrictions.
  • Earn Continuing Education Units (CEUs): This training is accredited, allowing you to earn additional CEUs to fulfill your professional development requirements.

How to Register:

Advance your clinical practice and skills with this comprehensive advanced training session. Register Now to secure your spot.

For more information or any questions, please contact us at info@grastontechnique.com.

Don’t miss this opportunity to elevate your expertise in the Graston Technique® and provide even better care for your patients!
Categories: Advanced Training > ADV In-Person, Advanced Training

Name: Essential Virtual Training - (Sep 13, 2025)

Event Details:

  • Time: 11:00 am - 03:30 pm
  • Second Day: Sep 14, 2025
  • Time: 11:00 am - 03:30 pm
  • Format: 3-hour self-paced pre-course + live virtual sessions
  • Platform: Zoom
  • Instructor: Greg Kelley
  • CEUs: 12 Continuing Education Units

Join Our Comprehensive Graston Technique Virtual Training and Earn 12 CEUs!

Elevate your professional skills with our Essential Virtual Training on Sep 13, 2025. This flexible program begins with a 3-hour self-paced pre-course, allowing you to learn the fundamentals at your convenience. Following the pre-course, join live group sessions hosted on Zoom by renowned instructor Greg Kelley, an expert in the Graston Technique (GT).

Course Highlights:

  • Hands-On Lab Sessions: Experience practical training covering key body areas, such as the knee, hip, spine, shoulder, and more.
  • Expert-Led Instruction: Gain in-depth knowledge and skills with guidance from Greg Kelley, ensuring mastery in instrument-assisted soft tissue mobilization (IASTM).
  • Earn 12 CEUs: This course qualifies for 12 Continuing Education Units (CEUs), helping you meet your professional development goals while enhancing patient outcomes.

Why Attend This Training?

  • Flexible Learning: Start with a self-paced pre-course and continue with live sessions tailored to your schedule.
  • Professional Growth: Expand your clinical skills and earn valuable CEUs.
  • Expert Guidance: Learn directly from Greg Kelley, a leading authority in the field of soft tissue mobilization.

 Secure your spot in the Essential Virtual Training and take your practice to the next level.

This training is perfect for healthcare professionals looking to deepen their expertise in the Graston Technique and enhance patient care. Don’t miss this opportunity to advance your skills and achieve your certification with 12 CEUs!

Name: Essential Training - Edmonton, AB (Nov 22, 2025)
Description:
Date: Nov 22, 2025 Time: 08:00 am - 06:00 pm Location: Edmonton, AB Instructor: John Dang Earn 12 CEUs Event Overview Join us for the Graston Technique® Essential Training, a comprehensive workshop designed to introduce healthcare professionals to the Graston Technique® (GT) therapy, a leading instrument-assisted soft tissue mobilization (IASTM) technique. This full-day training will provide hands-on learning and education on the foundational principles and practices of GT, enabling participants to enhance their clinical skills and improve patient outcomes. What to Expect
  • Foundational Training: Gain in-depth knowledge of the Graston Technique® therapy principles, instrument application, and treatment protocols.
  • Hands-On Experience: Practice using the GT instruments in a supervised setting with direct feedback from an expert instructor.
  • Clinical Applications: Learn how to integrate GT therapy into your practice to treat a wide variety of musculoskeletal conditions effectively.
Why Attend?
  • Earn 12 CEUs upon completion.
  • Equip yourself with the latest techniques in instrument-assisted soft tissue mobilization.
  • Network with fellow healthcare professionals and expand your professional connections.
Registration Details
    • Fee: $650
Includes: Access to online pre-course material, live group training sessions, GT instruments for use during the event, and a certificate of completion.
Categories: Essential Training > ESS In-Person, Essential Training
